The system shall execute an emergency Return-to-Home (RTH) procedure when the battery level falls below 15%, calculating the most energy-efficient route.
The system shall provide real-time telemetry data, including altitude, speed, and GPS coordinates, to the Ground Control Station (GCS) at a minimum rate of 10Hz.
The system shall allow authorized operators to remotely override the autonomous flight path and assume manual control within 1 second of command issuance.
The system shall autonomously identify and reroute around dynamic no-fly zones communicated by air traffic control via the API.
The system shall record and log all flight events, including sensor readings and command inputs, with a timestamp accuracy of +/- 1 millisecond.
The system shall execute flight control loop calculations (e.g., PID adjustments) with a deterministic latency not exceeding 5 milliseconds under maximum concurrent processing load.
The system shall maintain 100% availability of its core flight control module (FCM) during all phases of flight, excluding scheduled maintenance periods.
The system shall be capable of horizontally scaling its mission planning service to accommodate a minimum of 50 simultaneous flight plan updates per second without degradation in response time.
The system shall recover from a non-critical sensor failure (e.g., single GPS drop-out) and seamlessly transition to a redundant input source within 100 milliseconds.
The system shall implement a role-based access control (RBAC) mechanism to ensure that only authenticated ground control stations can issue flight commands.
The system shall calculate and display posts from users the current user follows, prioritizing content based on a recency decay function.
The system shall identify and suppress posts that have been explicitly marked as spam or contain prohibited content according to the content policy engine.
The system shall include a mechanism to inject sponsored content from advertisers into the feed at a predetermined rate of one ad every 5 organic posts.
The system shall filter the feed based on explicit user preferences, allowing users to select categories such as 'Following Only' or 'Trending'.
The system shall adjust the visibility score of a post dynamically based on the velocity of engagement (likes, comments) it receives within the first hour of publication.
The system shall render a personalized feed to any active user within 500 milliseconds, 99% of the time, even during peak concurrent usage of 1 million requests per second.
The feed generation service shall be capable of horizontally auto-scaling its processing capacity by 20% within 5 minutes of detecting a sustained traffic increase of 10% or more.
The system shall ensure that user interaction data (likes, shares, comments) is processed and reflected in the feed ranking model within 2 seconds of the event occurring.
The feed ranking microservice shall have an automated rollback capability to revert to the previous algorithm version within 1 minute upon deployment failure or a critical performance degradation.
The system shall encrypt all user interaction and preference data transmitted between the feed algorithm service and the database using TLS 1.3.
The system shall calculate gross pay based on the employee's documented hourly rate or annual salary and recorded hours or work period.
The system shall generate and provide annual tax forms (e.g., W-2, T4) to each employee through a secure self-service portal by the required legal deadline.
The system shall automatically calculate and deduct federal, state, and local taxes based on the employee's tax declarations and the official government tax tables.
The system shall process and remit payments to employees via direct deposit or check, ensuring funds are available on the specified payday.
The system shall allow authorized payroll administrators to modify an employee's tax status, deduction amounts, or bank information only after multi-factor authentication.
The system shall, upon request, provide an auditable log of all data access and modifications to an employee's personal identifiable information (PII) for a minimum of seven years.
The system shall ensure that all employee personal and financial data is encrypted at rest using AES-256 encryption.
The system shall automatically flag and quarantine any employee record or transaction that triggers a validation rule failure based on current governmental tax regulations.
The system shall provide a user interface compliant with WCAG 2.1 Level AA accessibility standards for all payroll administration and employee self-service screens.
The system shall allow for the deletion or anonymization of employee personal data within 30 days of a formal request, in compliance with GDPR 'right to be forgotten' requirements.
The system shall allow the user to select 'Guest Checkout' without requiring account registration.
The system shall automatically validate the format of the user-entered credit card number (e.g., length, Luhn algorithm) before submission.
The system shall display the calculated shipping costs and estimated delivery date based on the user's selected shipping address and method.
The system shall persist the items in the shopping cart for a minimum of 7 days if the user is logged in, or 24 hours if the user is a guest.
The system shall present a clear and accessible confirmation message upon successful payment, displaying the order number and a link to the order details.
The system shall load the entire checkout page, from cart review to final payment button, in under 1.5 seconds on a standard 4G connection.
The system shall ensure all interactive elements on the checkout page (buttons, input fields) meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA contrast ratio standards (at least 4.5:1).
The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime for the payment processing gateway during core shopping hours (9:00 AM to 9:00 PM local time).
The system shall automatically clear the session and encrypt any stored temporary payment information (e.g., card token) after 10 minutes of user inactivity on the checkout page.
The system shall ensure the checkout flow is fully navigable and operable using only keyboard controls, following standard tab order conventions.
The system shall accept and validate limit, market, and stop order types for all supported assets.
The system shall maintain a real-time, consolidated order book displaying aggregated bid and ask quantities for the top 10 price levels.
The system shall execute trade settlements, updating the user's cash and asset balances within 5 seconds of receiving the trade confirmation.
The system shall generate and provide detailed, time-stamped audit trails for every order state change (e.g., received, filled, cancelled).
The system shall calculate and display the current margin utilization and buying power for each user account in real-time.
The system shall utilize a microservices architecture to decouple the Order Management Service (OMS) from the Market Data Service (MDS) to prevent cascading failures.
The system shall implement event-driven communication via a message queue (e.g., Kafka) between trading services to ensure asynchronous, non-blocking order propagation.
The system shall achieve sub-20 millisecond end-to-end latency for 99.9% of all order placement and execution acknowledgement messages between the client API and the core execution engine.
The system shall enforce data consistency across all geographically distributed database replicas using a strongly consistent replication model to prevent race conditions in account balances.
The system shall support blue/green deployment strategies for all core trading services to enable zero-downtime updates and rapid rollback capabilities.

As a drone operator, I need to be able to manually override autonomous flight mode in case of emergency, so that I can regain control and save the situation.
If the drone's battery level falls below 20% and the environment is deemed hazardous, then immediate manual takeover is required to prevent accident.
Database queries cannot exceed 200ms under load to prevent data inconsistencies and delays in processing.
I need the autonomous drone to be able to communicate with the ground station within a 5-mile radius to ensure seamless handovers.
When the drone encounters obstacles that are too large to be safely bypassed, then it must automatically switch to manual flight mode.
As a patient, I want to view my medical history so that I can track my conditions and medications.
If a user attempts to access a protected area without authentication, then access to that area is denied immediately.
Error Scenario: When the API fails, the user must see a cached version of the previous successful request.
I need the dashboard to automatically refresh every minute to provide the most up-to-date information.
Database queries cannot exceed 200ms under load to prevent performance issues.
As a patient, I want to be able to access my medical records so that I can better manage my health.
If a user forgets their login credentials, then they must be prompted to enter a recovery code immediately.
Database queries cannot exceed 200ms under load, or it will negatively impact system performance.
I need the system to automatically sync with all healthcare providers I've listed within the next 24 hours, so I don't have duplicate records.
When the system is experiencing high network latency, then it should automatically switch to a cached version of the patient's records to minimize delays.
As a homeowner, I want to be able to grant guests access to specific features, so that I can manage my home's security and comfort remotely.
If a user attempts to access a feature that requires a higher permission level than their current role, then an error message must be displayed.
When the API fails, the user must see a cached version of the home dashboard to prevent data loss.
Database queries cannot exceed 200ms under load to prevent performance issues.
I need the dashboard to automatically refresh every minute to provide real-time updates.
When user logs in from an untrusted network, all data encryption must be automatically switched to AES-256-GCM.
Data at rest must never be stored in plain text unless we have explicit affirmative consent from the owner.
If any endpoint is down for more than 15 minutes, the entire system must go into failover mode to prevent data loss.
As a homeowner, I want the smart home controller to automatically update its software whenever a new update is available, so that I can be sure I have the latest features and security patches.
The smart home system cannot support more than 500 devices connected at the same time, as that would require additional maintenance resources.
As a user, I want to see the most relevant posts in my feed so that I have a better understanding of my community's needs.
If a post is recent, then it should be displayed at the top of the feed immediately.
I need the dashboard to automatically refresh every minute to ensure I have the latest posts.
When a user reports a post, then it should be removed from their feed immediately to prevent spam.
Database queries cannot exceed 200ms under load to prevent performance issues.
As a social media manager, I want the algorithm to prioritize trending topics so that I can effectively engage with my audience.
If the user is accessing the feed from a slow internet connection, then the algorithm should prioritize cached content to reduce load time.
Database queries cannot exceed 200ms under load, and the algorithm should be designed to minimize database queries at peak hours.
I need the algorithm to automatically categorize user-generated content by type, such as videos, photos, and text posts.
When a user reports spam content, the algorithm should immediately remove it from the feed to prevent it from being seen by other users.
As a patient, I want to view my medical history so that I can access important information about my health.
If a user submits a new prescription request, then the system immediately sends it to the pharmacy for verification.
When a user attempts to access a protected area without valid credentials, the system displays an error message and locks their account.
Database queries for retrieving patient data cannot exceed 200ms under load.
When the API fails, the user must see a cached version of the requested data to prevent data loss.
As a patient, I want to receive medication reminders so that I can stay on top of my treatment.
If the user is not logged in, then the portal should only show essential information.
Database queries cannot exceed 200ms under load, or else the user experience will degrade significantly.
I need the patient portal to automatically update after a user confirms a change of medications.
When the user enters their name, then the system will be required to check for and display a patient's complete medical history.
he app shall run on a smart phone with Android OS least version 2.3 .

News will be restricted to what is available in the feeds on the list of news RSS-feeds.

The search response time for the system must consistently be within two seconds, with an ideal goal of one second, based on measurments from 1000 searches during testing.
System dependability ensures users are informed of any issues for trusted system performance , measured during testing and prioritized highly.
The application should ideally use less than 10 MB of storage space, with a hard limit of 20 MB.
The applications memory usage on the mobile operating system should ideally be below 10 MB, with a strict limit of 20 MB during operation.
The system should reliably deliver accurate search results in over 98% of cases, aiming for 99% or even perfect accuracy during operation
The system should be accessible to users more than 98% of the time, ideally aiming for 99% or even continuous uptime.
The application requires an internet connection to function.
The application requires a GPS connection for functionality.
Login communication must be 100% encrypted to prevent usernames and passwords from being intercepted during data exchange between the application and server.
The restaurant owner login system must always prevent unauthorized access by notifying users of failed login attempts with non-existent accounts.
The admin login system must always block unauthorized access and notify admins of failed login attempts with non-existent accounts.
To prevent unauthorized access, restaurant owner accounts will be locked for 30 minutes after three failed login attempts, disabling login functionality during that period.
Admin accounts will be secured by a 30-minute lockout following three failed login attempts, preventing access from that IP address during the lockout period.
The system will enforce unique usernames during user account creation, prompting users to choose a different username if their desired one is already taken.
Restaurant owner account creation prioritizes security by enforcing unique usernames, requiring them to choose a different option if their desired name is unavailable.
The application's code structure should be designed for easy extension, facilitating the addition of new features.
The application will require well-defined test environments to ensure thorough testing of its various functionalities.
The application should be designed for easy porting between iOS and Android platforms.
The system must support 10,000 concurrent users with a maximum response time of 2 seconds.
The system will be developed using Waterfall methodology, Object-Oriented Programming in Java, targeting Android devices 2.3 onwards with a mandatory internet connection.
The system will be designed in such a way that the algorithms for the four main units will be able to be easily swapped out.
The overall accuracy of the Web APIs response will be measured using a developer-made testing set.
The overall accuracy is calculated by dividing total number of correct answers by the number of questions asked.
The accuracy of the Generic Question Construction part will be close to 80%
The system will be designed in such a way that the algorithms for the four main units will be easily swapped out.

A Drexel University Web API is being designed to answer questions about campus facilities, staff, policies, dining, and food trucks, with accuracy ranging from 40% for food trucks to 80% for generic question construction.
The average time for the server to respond, over the question testing set, will be less than or equal to 2 seconds
The connection between the Web API and the programs will use HTTPS, for security.
A new user will make less than 3 mistakes in 5 minutes after 5 minutes of use.
The search feature should be prominent and easy to find for the user.
The different search options should be evident, simple and easy to understand.
Users should be able to easily understand and select results from the list with just a single click.
Map results should be clear and user-friendly, allowing selection of any pin with a single click.
The information link for each result should be clear, easy to identify, and open with just a single click.
The user interface should be GUI based.
The user shall be able to enter data using a cell phone keypad layout.
Users shall be able to configure settings both locally on the device and remotely.
The system shall provide selection menus to minimize the need for manual typing of options.
Application prioritizes fast network response as it relies heavily on data retrieval rather than phone processing power.
The application itself will only have minimal logic and so there should be little to no issues with the computation required by the phone itself.
The only hazard is a user using the device when they should not be, such as while driving.
Secure connection to an internal system shall be required for user login and identification.

The primary attribute of this application will be usability given the large amounts of data and information that will be presented on such a small screen, as well as the users ability to input data into the device in a reasonable manner that should not be that much more difficult than if they were at an actual computer.

With regards to the intended number of users in the Amsterdam pilot, and the projected load scenarios, the intention is for the system to be able to serve 20.000 queries / day (in large part during the 4 peak traffic hours).
Users shall be able to trust and understand the system through its simplicity and transparency.
The system shall anonymize and aggregate route information to enable safe sharing without compromising user privacy.
The system shall employ encryption for all privacy-sensitive data at rest to ensure both security and basic functionality.

The system shall empower end-users to manage their private data, including the option to delete their personal repository.
The system shall be multilingual, supporting English, Turkish, Finnish, and Italian for international deployment.

The application shall be extensible, allowing skilled Java Android programmers to add new sub-applications with launchers to the main interface.

A MySQL database will be used to store all information required to answer questions.
The system shall be able to populate the database with extracted information prior to full system initialization.
The database will use the generic representations from R4.2.2.1 as table names or column headers for easier retrieval of data.
The database will be updated periodically and the API will be unavailable during the update.
Structural data sources will have their data stored in our database
For data with enough structuring, web scraping will be used to programmatically extract all the data needed and store it in our database.
For totally unstructured information, AI libraries will be used to programmatically extract and store any information possible
Data that is especially hard to extract, for whatever reason, will be manually extracted and added to the database by a developer.
The GUI will have a textbox that will accept inputs from a keyboard.
Text box will originally contain a suggestive text question, to guide the user to the format of an appropriate question.
The GUI will have a Send button which sends text from the textbox to the API when clicked
The GUI will have a chat window displaying questions sent to the system and responses from the API.
The chat window will contain all questions and answers from the current session, with a scroll bar if all messages cant fit on the screen.
If there is a network issue, the chat window will display an error message.
There will be a designated phone number that users can send texts to.
Texts sent to that number will be sent to the API, then the system will reply to the user with the answer as another text message.
If a question is not understood by our API, the system will send a text containing an example question after the text with the API response.
The feature of the application shall provide the optimized route for the given addresses
The system shall be able to find the best route for multiple addresses, including fixing any gaps between them.
While a fast internet connection is optional, the system shall be designed to perform optimally with a fast connection.
The system shall be able to dynamically load new maps in response to each user request.
The system shall ensure compliance with Google Maps API terms of use by adhering to Google's policies.

the system shall enforce role-based access control (RBAC) for its functionalities.

All error messages produced by the System must be meaningful, so that they can be appropriately acted upon by the users who are likely to see them.
The System must employ a single set of user interface rules, or a small number of sets to provide a familiar and common look and feel for the application.
Ideally, each error message will be accompanied by explanatory text and an indication of the action(s) which the user can take in response to the error.
The System must be able to display several entities (cases, suspects) simultaneously.
The system shall allow users to customize interface elements (displayed columns, layout) and save these preferences in their profiles.
The System must provide End User and Administrator functions which are easy to use and intuitive throughout.

The system shall comply with Standard ISO 9241 for user interface design.
The system shall provide textual descriptions or alternative functionalities for all non-text media like images and videos.

The user interface shall display clear error messages explaining the issue and suggesting solutions, all in the user's chosen language.

Users shall be able to resize text using built-in functions or appropriate methods.

The system shall ensure text readability considering display characteristics and follow ISO 9241-303 for screen text legibility.
System shall use clear and familiar labels for navigation links, considering users' general knowledge and experience with similar systems.
The system shall be able to clearly mark links that open in new browser windows or pop-up windows.

The system shall be able to process inter-faculty transfer requests initiated by authorized users and approved by faculty groups or higher levels.
The system shall require university group approval for outgoing transfers.

The system shall be able to grant edit permissions for assets to departmental administrators, inventory users, faculty users, and university users based on their department affiliation and authorization level.
The system shall be able to modify all fields of an edited asset except for identifier (ID) fields.
The system shall be able to accept bulk entry files for data import.
The system shall be able to automatically assign ownership of any asset to the department if the asset is assigned to a DA group member or an authorized inventory group member.
The system shall be able to allow any faculty member to add inventory for all departments they have access to.
The system shall allow any authorized university group member to add assets to the inventory.
