The search for the preferred repair facility should be completed within 8 seconds.
The recycled parts audit report must be returned within 10 seconds.
Preferred repair facility ratings should be saved within 5 seconds.
The product shall adhere to the corporate online availability schedule. The application is brought down only within 98% of the scheduled outages per the availability schedule.
The product shall achieve a 98% uptime. The product shall not fail more than 2% of the available online time.
The product shall be able to handle up to 1500 simultaneous users. The system shall perform with 1500 users as a time.
The average number of recycled parts records per day shall be 50,000.
The product shall be able to handle 10,000 concurrent users within 2 years of the initial launch.
For estimators, the product shall be able to be operated in a repair facility during dirty and noisy conditions.

Only adjusters can request recycled parts audit reports.
Only adjusters with a supervisor role can update preferred repair facility ratings.
Only collision estimators shall search for recycled parts. Users without the collision estimator role shall not have access to the search for recycled parts.
Only valid data shall be entered into the system. No invalid data shall be entered into the system.
One insurance company shall not be able to view another insurance company's claim data.
The product shall be free of computer viruses.
The system shall prevent malicious attacks, including denial of service.
The product must comply with Sarbanes-Oxley.
The product shall comply with the estimatics laws relating to recycled parts usage.
The product shall comply with insurance regulations regarding claims processing.
The user shall search for the preferred repair facility using vehicle location and radius in miles.
The vehicle data shall include vehicle year, make, and model.
The vehicle location shall include street address, city, state, and zipcode.
The system shall resolve the zipcode for the street address, city, and state if zipcode is unknown.
The search radius shall be between 1 and 30 miles.
The system shall locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings for the input criteria.
The adjuster shall enter the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment.
The adjuster shall be able to override the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment.
The preferred repair facility shall be returned to the user.
The system shall return a list of repair facilities within the radius if the preferred repair facility cannot be determined.
The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using damaged vehicle parts information.
The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using a list of preferred parts suppliers.
The system shall search for available recycled parts for the supplied vehicle parts and suppliers.
The estimator shall search by zipcode with a radius of 30 miles if no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers.
The system shall retain the available recycled parts and suppliers returned from the search.
The available recycled parts information and their suppliers shall be returned to the user.
The estimator shall apply selected recycled parts to the collision estimate.
The estimator shall not apply recycled parts to the collision estimate if no available parts are returned.
The adjuster shall review the collision estimate.
The adjuster shall request a recycled parts audit of the collision estimate.
The recycled parts search results provided to the estimator shall be retrieved by the system.
The system shall generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate.
The audit report shall include the total number of recycled parts used in the estimate.
The audit report shall include the number of available recycled parts from the original search results.
The audit report shall include the percentage of available recycled parts used in the estimate.
The audit report shall include the total score of the audit which sums the individual line items.
The audit report shall be displayed to the user.
The audit report shall be available to other adjusters at later points in time.
The user shall select to view the preferred repair facility ratings.
The current repair facility ratings shall be displayed to the user.
The system will display a blank set of ratings if there are not ratings yet defined.
The user shall enter new ratings based on the audit report.
The ratings shall be from a scale of 1-10.
The ratings shall include categories for attempted use of recycled parts and actual use of recycled parts.
The user shall select to save the preferred repair facility ratings.
The preferred repair facility ratings shall be saved by the system.

Aside from server failure the software product shall achieve 99.99% up time.
The product shall create an exception log of problems encountered within the product for transmission to our company for analysis and resolution.

When creating a new session, the session creator shall assign one or more moderators.
When creating a new session, the session creator shall assign the session a name.
When creating a new session, the session creator shall create a problem description.
When creating a new session, the session creator shall be able to set an open and close time and date.
When creating a new session, the session creator shall be able to toggle whether the session is secure or not.
A moderator shall be able to edit a previously created session.
The session shall conclude after the specified amount of time has passed.
The session shall conclude if a specified amount of ideas has been generated.
The moderator shall be able to close a session at any time.
The moderator shall be able to open a closed session.
A moderator shall be able to assign the maximum number of participants to a session.
All sessions shall be able to have multiple moderators.
Session creators and moderators shall be able to import data from previously closed sessions into a currently open session.
All sessions shall be associated with a single EDGE project.
The moderator shall be able to specify a time warning until the current phase is completed.
The moderator shall be able to view a session management screen.
The users shall be able to add/edit/remove their own ideas.
The system shall inform the user if they have reached their limit of created nodes.
A Moderator shall be able to limit the number of nodes that an individual user can create.
A Moderator shall be able to limit the maximum number of nodes that can be created in a session.
All user created nodes shall be filtered for profanity and removed if any exists.
A Moderator shall be able to specify a warning for total ideas remaining.
A Moderator shall be able to specify a warning for total time remaining.
Users shall be verified upon logging in LDAP.
Users shall be able to select a session based on the FACET and the tool they wish to use.
The moderator shall be able to set a warning time to email users how many minutes are left in the current session.
The screen shall allow the moderator to filter/sort/view/edit/close sessions.
Secure sessions will require users to have been guest members before logging in.
A moderator shall be able to enter in teasers.
Teasers shall be tracked in the database the same as ideas are tracked.
Each idea shall be listed on its own line in a numbered list in the idea phase.
By default, the page shall not auto scroll when new ideas are added into the list.
There shall be a setting to allow new ideas to be added to the top of the list.
Only a moderator shall be able to group ideas and specify a name for the group.
Users shall be able to flag inappropriate content.
Flagged ideas shall go to a separate moderator page for resolution.
The moderator shall be able to remove/edit any ideas during the idea and grouping phases.
Voters shall not be aware of multiplicity in ideas.
The moderator shall be able to view all grouped ideas, including duplicates.
The idea field shall be limited to a maximum of 250 characters to match the current EDGE system limitation.
Moderators shall be able to combine groups with other groups.
Moderators shall be able to remove groups.
A Moderator shall be able to assign a number of votes for participants.
Users shall be able to vote for any individual idea or an idea group.
The displayed number of total ideas shall be updated frequently.

A batch program shall periodically predict diseases based on consultation requests using a machine learning algorithm and prioritize the requests.

Quarterly, patient profiles without consultation requests for the last 3 years and consultation requests more than 3 years old shall be archived to improve performance.
Every night, a full backup of the system (database and code) shall be taken and sent to a remote site for safekeeping, with backups rotated every 30 days.
Administration shall improve the disease prediction database monthly based on the learning from the prior month.

A server shall host the RMOS and provide system data processing and storage  capability.
A surface computer shall provide a customer with all customer system  functionality.
A tablet shall provide a waiter/supervisor with all waiter/supervisor system  functionality (according to access control).
A display shall provide a chef with all chef system functionality.
All system functionality shall be accessible through touch sensitive surface  computers, tablets and displays via simple touch gestures.
A tablet shall be capable of interfacing with a register to facilitate the accurate  processing of a payment.
A customer shall be able to engage their menu by double tapping the activated  surface computer in their table.
A customer shall be able to dismiss their menu by double tapping its dismiss  option.
A customer shall be able to create an empty pending order through their  engaged menu.
A customer shall not be able to dismiss their engaged menu while there is a  non-empty pending order associated with the engaged menu.
A customer shall be able to navigate through the available items in their  engaged menu.
A customer shall be able to add an item to a pending order by dragging the  item from the engaged menu onto the order.
A customer shall be able to remove an item from a pending order by dragging  the item off the order.
A customer shall be able to add a special dietary requirement to an order by  dragging the requirement from the engaged menu onto the order.
A customer shall be able to add a wildcard special dietary requirement to an  order in the case that their requirement is not represented by the system.
A customer shall be able to place an order through their engaged menu if it is  pending and not empty.
A customer shall be able to cancel an order through their engaged menu if it is  pending and not yet placed.
A customer shall be able to call for waiter assistance through their engaged  menu.
A customer shall be able to engage bill mode to finalise payment through their  engaged menu.
A customer shall be able to disengage bill mode to cancel the billing process  through their engaged menu.
When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of a  cash payment for the whole table.
When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of a  bankcard payment for each customer.
When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of  every meal ordered that may each be dragged into a payment.
When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of tip  denominations that may be dragged into a payment.
A customer shall be able to drag a meal into a bankcard payment or a cash  payment.
A customer shall be able to drag a meal out of a bankcard payment or a cash  payment.
A customer shall be able to drag a tip denomination into a bankcard payment  or a cash payment.
A customer shall be able to drag a tip denomination out of a bankcard payment  or a cash payment.
A waiter shall be able to log into a tablet using their assigned username and  password.
A waiter shall be able to log out of a tablet.
A waiter shall be able to activate a surface computer and consequently open its  associated account through a tablet.
A waiter shall be able to deactivate a surface computer and consequently close  its associated account through a tablet.
A waiter who activates a surface computer shall be assigned to the table that  contains it.
A tablet shall allow a waiter to accept an order placed by a customer through a  surface computer.
A tablet shall allow a waiter to reject an order placed by a customer through a  surface computer.
A tablet shall allow a waiter to indicate the delivery of an item to its customer.
A tablet shall allow a waiter to process a payment using cash.
A tablet shall allow a waiter to process a payment using a bankcard.
A chef shall be able to accept a customers order item through a display.
A chef shall be able to reject a customers order item through a display.
A chef shall be able to indicate that a customers order item is ready to be served through a display.
A supervisor shall be able to do everything a waiter can.
A supervisor shall be able to do everything a chef can.
A supervisor shall be able to abort/purge a customers meal from the active  system with no expectation of payment.
A supervisor shall be able to abort/purge a table's account/meals from the  active system with no expectation of payment.
A supervisor shall be able to issue a refund for one or more items to a  customer.
The system shall log every state and state change of every surface computer,  tablet and display to provision recovery from system failure.
The system shall be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event  of failure (e.g. a system crash or power loss).
The system shall be able to display a menu at all times to facilitate manual  order taking should the need arise.
The system shall utilise periodic 30-second keep-alive messages between  tablets and the server to monitor tablet operational status.
The system shall flag tablets that fail to send timely keep-alive messages as  non-operational and disassociate the assigned waiter from the tablet.
Wireless communication throughout the system will be encrypted using SSLv3  at the application layer and WPA2-PSK at the data link layer.
The WPA2-PSK password used for wireless communication must have a bit-  strength of at least 80 bits.
The WPA2-PSK password used for wireless communication must be changed  every three months.
A waiter password used for tablet login must be changed every three months.
A waiter shall only be able to log into one tablet at any given instance of time.
A waiter that attempts to log into a second tablet while already logged into another tablet shall be rejected and notified through both tablets.
A surface computer shall not require a user to log in.
A tablet shall require a user to log in using a username and password.
A display shall not require a user to log in.
Any element of the system will take no longer than 10-seconds to restart.
A surface computer must not dismiss an engaged menu unless the customer  requests it.
The server shall be capable of supporting no less than 200 concurrent  connections from any combination of surface computers, tablets and displays.
The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of surface  computers, tablets and displays, that is, it shall provide no limit on how many  devices are in the system.
The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active  meals/orders, that is, no meals/orders shall be lost under any circumstances.
The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active  customer payments, that is, no payments shall be lost under any  circumstances.

The server shall be capable of supporting no less than 200 concurrent connections from any combination of computers, tablets, and displays.
The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active orders, that is, no orders shall be lost under any circumstances.
The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active customer payments, that is, no payments shall be lost under any circumstances.
The server shall have at least 4 vCPUs, either x86_64 or arm64 architecture.
The server shall have a supported version of a common Linux distribution (Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, Ubuntu 22.10, CentOS, Debian, or RHEL).
The user connecting to the server shall have a supported shell (bash, dash, fish, csh, tcsh, ksh, or zsh).
The following utilities shall be available on the server: tar, wget (or curl), dd, chmod, test, mkdir, echo, mv, uname, command, and gzip.
The $HOME environment variable shall be set correctly on the server.
The $HOME/.cache folder shall be writable by the user connecting to the server.
The IDE and the project shall be located on a local file system (network block storage like EBS is acceptable, network file systems like NFS or SMB are not).
OpenSSH server version 7.9p1 or later shall be installed on the server (other SSH servers fully implementing RFC 4254 may work but are not supported).
SSH port forwarding shall be enabled in the server configuration.
The server shall have at least 8 GB RAM.
The server shall have at least 500MB of free disk space even if the IDE is already installed.
The server shall have a higher clock frequency than core count (preferred).
The internet connection on the server shall have at least 50 Mbps downstream capacity.
The connection between the client and server shall have at least 20 Mbps bandwidth.
The connection between the client and server shall have no more than 200ms latency.
The server environment shall be single-tenant (no other applications running on the same server or container).
VS Code shall be downloadable as a file smaller than 200 MB.
VS Code shall require less than 500 MB of disk space after installation.
VS Code shall be lightweight and run easily on most modern hardware.
VS Code shall not support application virtualization solutions (Microsoft App-V, MSIX for Windows, or third-party alternatives).
VS Code shall require a full operating system when running in a virtual machine environment.
VS Code shall not support multiple simultaneous users on the same machine, including shared virtual desktops or pooled Windows/Linux Virtual Desktop host pools.

Running the full VS Code in Windows/Linux containers is not supported. However, using the Dev Containers extension with the VS Code server running in the container and the client on the desktop is supported.
VS Code shall require GLIBCXX version 3.4.25 or later.
VS Code shall require GLIBC version 2.28 or later.

The system shall support the following operating systems - Windows 10/11 (32-bit or 64-bit) and Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2016, or Windows Server 2012 (including R2)
The system shall be accessible through a compatible web browser on a computer or mobile device.
The system shall offer a mobile app for computers and mobile devices for accessing OneDrive.
The OneDrive mobile app shall be compatible with phones and tablets running Android 6.0 or later versions.
The system shall function on a processor with a minimum clock speed of 1.6 GHz.
The system shall be compatible with Intel-based Mac computers and Windows 10/11 ARM-based PCs.
The system shall have a minimum of 1 GB of RAM available.
The system display shall support a minimum resolution of 1024 x 576 pixels.
An internet connection is recommended for the system. (Note: This is a recommendation, not a requirement, so it's not converted to "shall".)
The system shall support file systems with case-insensitive behavior, including NTFS (Windows), HFS+ (Mac), and APFS (Mac).
User shall be able to perform validity checks on inputs.
System shall validate inputs and provide error messages for invalid data.

System shall establish relationships between inputs and outputs, including sequences and formulas.
User shall be able to perform data conversion as needed.
System shall provide data conversion functionality for various formats.
System shall support a maximum of 1000 terminals simultaneously.
System shall handle up to 500 simultaneous users without performance degradation.
System shall manage up to 10 terabytes of information in various formats.
System shall process up to 10,000 transactions per minute during normal workload conditions.
System shall handle up to 20,000 transactions per minute during peak workload conditions.
System shall process up to 50 tasks per second to maintain operational efficiency.
System shall complete data processing tasks within 2 seconds under normal workload conditions.
System shall complete data processing tasks within 5 seconds under peak workload conditions.
System shall maintain response time under 100 milliseconds for normal workload conditions.
System shall maintain response time under 200 milliseconds for peak workload conditions.
All numerical requirements stated above are subject to measurable performance monitoring and evaluation.

System shall use transaction management software (BMS version 2.0), card management software (CMS version 3.0), and Yamaha codecs.

System shall employ dial-up POS with central server using TCP/IP communication protocol.
Data transfer protocol shall be File Transfer Protocol (FTP).
The ATM shall provide customers with 24-hour service for consistent availability.
Card verification time must not exceed 0.8 seconds under normal server workload and 1 second under peak workload.
PIN verification time must not exceed 0.3 seconds under normal workload and 0.5 seconds under peak workload.
Account balance display time must not exceed 2 seconds under normal workload and 3 seconds under peak workload.
Account balance transfer time must not exceed 3 seconds under normal workload and 4 seconds under peak workload.
Cash withdrawal transaction time must not exceed 4 seconds under normal workload and 5 seconds under peak workload.
Deposit transaction time after envelope insertion must not exceed 5 seconds under normal workload and 6 seconds under peak workload.
Receipt printing time must not exceed 3 seconds under both normal and peak workloads.
Touch screen and button response time must not exceed 5000 milliseconds.
Credit card advance time must not exceed 6 seconds under both normal and peak workloads.
All code must be consistent with respect to style.
All functionality must be thoroughly tested through comprehensive test cases.
Data communication protocol shall ensure reliability and quality of data and voice transmission, such as CDMA.
Memory system shall be non-volatile to maintain data reliability.
System shall have a backup power supply for power failures.
Abnormal operations shall cause system shutdown.
ATM shall be manually restarted by maintenance personnel after an abnormal shutdown.
No inconsistency shall be introduced in the account during transactions affected by abnormal shutdowns.
System shall be compatible with AIMS security standards.
System shall use two levels of security: ATM card and PIN verification authenticated by CMS software.
Encryption standard during PIN transmission shall be triple DES.
Passwords shall be 6-14 characters long and not contain the user's name.
Passwords can include digits, hyphens, and underscores.
User shall be allowed up to three login attempts before the card is blocked.
Security camera shall be installed near the ATM.
Cash vault shall be secured with a combination lock.
ATM cabinet cover shall be made of fiberglass for security purposes.
System components such as modem, memory, disk, and drives shall be easily serviceable without vault access.

Staff shall monitor all city ATMs for faults and correct any issues immediately.
Staff shall maintain account backups for reliability and rollback changes during abnormal shutdowns.
User must file a First Information Report (FIR) and present a copy for card blocking in case of lost ATM card.
System shall generate logs of user bank account details, account updates with date, time, and changes, and fixed asset schedules.

User shall be able to insert a cash card, and the ATM shall check its validity, including card information readability and expiration date.

System shall log the serial number of a valid cash card.

System shall proceed with the authorization process if the password and serial number are correct.
System shall retain a cash card if entered more than three times with incorrect passwords and prompt the user to contact the bank.
User shall be able to withdraw cash by entering the desired amount, and the ATM shall check if the amount is within predefined limits.
System shall redo the transaction if the withdrawal amount exceeds allowed limits.
System shall perform the transaction by sending a request to the bank computer and waiting for a response.
System shall dispense cash if the transaction is successful and print a receipt while updating the cash amount and ejecting the card.
User shall collect the dispensed cash, and the ATM shall log the transaction amount against the serial number and send a response to the bank.
System shall display an error message and return the card if a transaction is unsuccessful.
System shall check the validity of the bank code upon request from the ATM.
System shall send a "bad bank code" message to the ATM if the bank code is invalid.
System shall check if the entered password is valid for the specified cash card.
System shall send a "bad password" message to the ATM if the password is invalid and update the invalid password count.
System shall send a "bad account" message to the ATM if there are account issues even with a valid cash card and password.
System shall send an "account ok" message to the ATM if the cash card, password, and account are valid.
System shall process transaction requests from the ATM, updating the account balance accordingly.
System shall update the user's account after receiving a response from the ATM about money dispensed.
System shall check the account's withdrawal limit and deny the transaction if the amount exceeds it.
